function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Scholars designing energy programs may overlook the impact of electric vehicles on sustainability, leading to potential negative consequences.","Impact":"Failure to address the impact of electric vehicles on sustainability could result in increased environmental damage and resource consumption.","Mitigation":"Conduct thorough research and analysis to understand the comprehensive impact of electric vehicles on sustainability, and incorporate this understanding into energy programs and policies.","Technologies":"Data analytics, environmental impact assessment tools, and sustainability impact modeling.","People":"Scholars, policymakers, and environmental professionals involved in energy program design and policy-making.","Owner":"Research organizations, government agencies, and environmental advocacy groups."},{"Description":"The promotion of electric vehicles may lead to increased car-based mobility and a decrease in the use of active and public transportation modes.","Impact":"Reduced use of active and public transportation modes could lead to increased traffic congestion, air pollution, and sedentary lifestyles.","Mitigation":"Promote integrated transportation systems that prioritize active and public transportation, and incentivize sustainable travel modes. Implement policies to discourage excessive dependence on car-based mobility.","Technologies":"Smart transportation systems, public transportation infrastructure, and mobility management platforms.","People":"Urban planners, transportation authorities, and policymakers focused on sustainable urban development.","Owner":"City councils, transportation agencies, and public-private partnerships."},{"Description":"The use of electric vehicles may contribute to urban sprawl and increased competition with public transport and shared services.","Impact":"Urban sprawl can lead to resource depletion, increased energy consumption, and reduced accessibility to essential services. Competition with public transport and shared services may undermine sustainable transportation initiatives.","Mitigation":"Implement urban planning strategies that prioritize compact, mixed-use development and sustainable transportation options. Develop policies to regulate the expansion of urban areas and promote a balanced transportation ecosystem.","Technologies":"Urban planning software, geographic information systems (GIS), and sustainable development modeling tools.","People":"Urban planners, policymakers, and environmental advocates focusing on urban sustainability.","Owner":"Local governments, urban development agencies, and sustainability-focused organizations."}]}
